intro: Youngia runcinata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by wind. Youngia runcinata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
